thread.title: Stranger approaches girl, 12, on Canton's west side

author: Hometownlife.com
title: Stranger approaches girl, 12, on Canton's west side
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Stranger approaches girl, 12, on Canton's west side A 12-year-old girl walking alone on Canton's west side managed to flee to safety Post to Facebook Stranger approaches girl, 12, on Canton's west side A 12-year-old girl walking alone on Canton's west side managed to flee to safety Check out this story on Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/2m29C0M Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address.   Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Stranger approaches girl, 12, on Canton's west side By Darrell Clem, Hometownlife.com 7:54 p.m. ET Feb. 20, 2017 A Wyoming Public Safety officer and Grand Rapids woman are recovering from injuries after being hit by another car on northbound US-131 early Wednesday morning. (Photo: pattilabelle, Getty Images/iStockphoto) 3 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
A 12-year-old girl walking alone on Canton's west side managed to flee to safety after a male stranger pulled alongside her in his car and asked her to get inside, police said. 
The incident occurred shortly after 11:30 a.m. Monday in the Cherry Hill Village area, prompting police to warn residents to remain vigilant and to report any further "stranger danger" incidents, suspicious people or vehicles. 
The girl was walking alone when a suspect described as a white male, in his 30s or 40s, pulled alongside her in a silver or gray, four-door, mid-sized sedan, authorities said. Police say the man had a dark goatee and wore a beanie cap and a hooded sweatshirt. 
Read more: MSU president Simon: 'No culture of tolerance of sexual assault' 
The girl fled to a nearby friend's house when the man asked her to get into his vehicle, which was last seen in the area of Cherry Hill and Denton roads. 
Detective Sgt. Dan Traylor said Monday evening there had been no further reports of similar incidents in Canton. 
"It's an open investigation at this time," he said. 
Residents are urging anyone who has information about the incident to call the Canton Police Department at 734-394-5400. 
dclem@hometownlife.com
